ServerMessageHandler Class Reference
[Network]

This abstract class defines the interface that is called by ServerConnection::processInput. More...

#include <server_message_handler.hpp>

 This method is called when an enableEntities request was rejected.

Detailed Description

This abstract class defines the interface that is called by ServerConnection::processInput.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onBasePlayerCreate ( EntityID  id,
EntityTypeID  type,
BinaryIStream &  data 
) [pure virtual]

This method is called to create a new player as far as required to talk to the base entity.

Only data shared between the base and the client is provided in this method - the cell data will be provided by onCellPlayerCreate later if the player is put on the cell also.

Implemented in EntityManager.

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onCellPlayerCreate ( EntityID  id,
SpaceID  spaceID,
EntityID  vehicleID,
const Position3D &  pos,
float  yaw,
float  pitch,
float  roll,
BinaryIStream &  data 
) [pure virtual]

This method is called to create a new player as far as required to talk to the cell entity.

Only data shared between the cell and the client is provided in this method - the base data will have been previously provided by onBasePlayerCreate.

Implemented in EntityManager.

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onEnableEntitiesRejected (  )  [inline, virtual]

This method is called when an enableEntities request was rejected.

Usually it is because the server is in the middle of an update. The handler should check latest and impending versions and try later. (also the impending version may need to have been fully downloaded)

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onEntitiesReset ( bool  keepPlayerOnBase  )  [inline, virtual]

This method is called when the server tells us to reset all our entities.

The player entity may optionally be saved (but still should not be considered to be in the world (i.e. no cell part yet))

Reimplemented in EntityManager.

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onEntityControl ( EntityID  id,
bool  control 
) [inline, virtual]

This method is called to indicate that the given entity is controlled by this client, at least as far as pose updates go.

i.e. You may move the entity around with calls to addMove. Currently, control is implicit for the player entity and may not be withdrawn.

Reimplemented in EntityManager.

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onEntityCreate ( EntityID  id,
EntityTypeID  type,
SpaceID  spaceID,
EntityID  vehicleID,
const Position3D &  pos,
float  yaw,
float  pitch,
float  roll,
BinaryIStream &  data 
) [pure virtual]

This method is called in response to a requestEntityUpdate message to provide the bulk of the information about this entity.

If the client has seen this entity before then data it already has is not resent (as determined by the CacheStamps sent in requestEntityUpdate).

Implemented in EntityManager.

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onEntityEnter ( EntityID  id,
SpaceID  spaceID,
EntityID  vehicleID 
) [pure virtual]

This method is called when an entity enters the client's AoI.

If the entity has not been seen before then spaceID need not be recorded, since it will be provided again in onEntityCreate.

Implemented in EntityManager.

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onEntityLeave ( EntityID  id,
const CacheStamps &  stamps 
) [pure virtual]

This method is called when an entity leaves the client's AoI.

The CacheStamps are a record of the data received about the entity to this point, that should be reported to the server if the entity is seen again via the requestEntityUpdate message.

Implemented in EntityManager.

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onEntityMethod ( EntityID  objectID,
int  messageID,
BinaryIStream &  data 
) [pure virtual]

This method is called when the server calls a method on an entity.

Implemented in EntityManager.

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onEntityMove ( EntityID  id,
SpaceID  spaceID,
EntityID  vehicleID,
const Position3D &  pos,
float  yaw,
float  pitch,
float  roll,
bool  isVolatile 
) [inline, virtual]

This method is called when the position of an entity changes.

This will only be received for a controlled entity if the server overrides the position directly (physics correction, teleport, etc.)

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onEntityMoveWithError ( EntityID  id,
SpaceID  spaceID,
EntityID  vehicleID,
const Position3D &  pos,
const Vector3 &  posError,
float  yaw,
float  pitch,
float  roll,
bool  isVolatile 
) [inline, virtual]

This method is called when the position of an entity changes.

This will only be received for a controlled entity if the server overrides the position directly (physics correction, teleport, etc.) This method is like onEntityMove but also receives an indication of how much error could be in the position that is caused by compression.

Reimplemented in EntityManager.

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onEntityProperties ( EntityID  id,
BinaryIStream &  data 
) [pure virtual]

This method is called by the server when it wants to provide multiple properties at once to the client for an entity in its AoI, such as when a detail level boundary is crossed.

Implemented in EntityManager.

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onEntityProperty ( EntityID  objectID,
int  messageID,
BinaryIStream &  data 
) [pure virtual]

This method is called when the server sets a property on an entity.

Implemented in EntityManager.

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onRestoreClient ( EntityID  id,
SpaceID  spaceID,
EntityID  vehicleID,
const Position3D &  pos,
const Direction3D &  dir,
BinaryIStream &  data 
) [inline, virtual]

This method is called to indicate that the client entity has been restored from a (recent) backup due to a failure on the server.

Reimplemented in EntityManager.

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onStreamComplete ( uint16  id,
const std::string &  desc,
BinaryIStream &  data 
) [inline, virtual]

This method is called to deliver downloads when they are complete.

This was called onProxyData() in BW1.8.x and earlier, and didn't have the description parameter.

Reimplemented in EntityManager.

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::onVoiceData ( const Mercury::Address &  srcAddr,
BinaryIStream &  data 
) [inline, virtual]

This method is called to deliver peer-to-peer data.

Reimplemented in EntityManager.

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::spaceData ( SpaceID  spaceID,
SpaceEntryID  entryID,
uint16  key,
const std::string &  data 
) [pure virtual]

This method is called when data associated with a space is received.

Implemented in EntityManager.

virtual void ServerMessageHandler::spaceGone ( SpaceID  spaceID  )  [pure virtual]

This method is called when the given space is no longer visible to the client.

Implemented in EntityManager.
